sentence.Network_en: His stories about his sexual experimentation were more bravado than fact.
sentence.Network_cn: 他讲述的那些自己进行性尝试的事，更多的是吹嘘而非事实。

sentence.Network_en: "You won't get away with this," he said with unexpected bravado.
sentence.Network_cn: “这事你休想就这么过去，”他以出人意料的强横语气说道。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Spanish bravada, from bravo 'bold' (see brave, -ado)

entry.def: Bravado is an appearance of courage or confidence that someone shows in order to impress other people.

example.ex: 'You won't  get away with this,' he said with unexpected bravado.
example.tran: “这事你休想就这么过去，”他以出人意料的强横语气说道。

auth_sentence.content: Then there were those who stayed from sheer bravado.
auth_sentence.res_content: Then there were those who stayed from sheer bravado.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then there were those who stayed from sheer bravado.

auth_sentence.content: Of course, this cheerful misanthropy was partly bravado.
auth_sentence.res_content: Of course, this cheerful misanthropy was partly bravado.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Of course, this cheerful misanthropy was partly bravado.

auth_sentence.content: He dismissed inquiries about his missing limb with bravado.
auth_sentence.res_content: He dismissed inquiries about his missing limb with bravado.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He dismissed inquiries about his missing limb with bravado.

sentences.en: ‘I’ll be fine on my own,’ she said with bravado.
sentences.cn: “我一个人没问题。”她逞能地说。

sentences.en: He behaved aggressively out of bravado.
sentences.cn: 他摆出一副挑衅的架势，但只是虛张声势。

sentences.en: Their behaviour was just sheer bravado.
sentences.cn: 他们的行为完全是虚张声势。
